alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Wind River Mountains East; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 8:33AM MST until January 06 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts possible on the highest peaks and southwest Yellowstone. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Yellowstone National Park, Absaroka Mountains and Wind River Mountains East. * WHEN...Until 11 PM Thursday. The snow will become lighter and decrease in coverage by late morning. However heavier snow will again break out after midnight tonight, and last through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel over passes will be difficult. Visibility could be down to a quarter mile at times. People recreating in the backcountry could become disoriented.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, water, and a charger for your cell phone in case of an emergency. Call 5 1 1, to get the latest road conditions.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Wind River Mountains East; Yellowstone National Park
